  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon cans of isopropanol (un1219) had been crushed by other freight and had released 5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023040144
item.description:
Report E-2023040144

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T06:12:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-27
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 27, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Ethanol Spec Ind PM 4217 200 P was punctured during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted surface. GES personnel deployed absorbents and swept them in with hand tools to collect the impacted solids. GES secured the damaged pail in one (1) 30-gallon drum with the spent absorbents and staged the drum onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: It is uncertain what initially caused the crack in the bottom of the plastic jerrican because the crack was discovered while it was sitting on the dock. It may have been set on metal debris in the trailer when it was loaded, and the crack/leak was discovered at the load time. As soon as it was discovered the jerrican was placed in a hazmat bag and QA was notified. DescribePack: There is a crack in the bottom of the jerrican near a molded seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent material was placed in the bottom of the hazmat bag to absorb the liquid and the jerrican was placed on it's side leaning toward the top away from the crack.

item.title: Report E-2023030295
item.description:
Report E-2023030295

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T06:12:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-10
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0829 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UTU) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture approximately 0.5 gallon of PPG Amerlock 400V Cure (Hazardous - UN3470) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #30. The terminal requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to the packaging and inner box due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The box containing 4 impacted pails, shrink wrap, and absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage. The unimpacted (12) 1-gallon pails were placed inside a 55-gallon poly drum to be sent on to the customer due to no other packing being available.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 14, 2023, at 1325 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Tucson, Arizona regarding the release of approximately 3,575 gallons of Nitric acid (Nitric acid, other than red fuming, with not more than 70% nitric acid, UN2031, 8, II) from (13) 250-gallon plastic IBC totes, reportedly due to a vehicle crash and rollover. Federal, state, and local emergency responders were already onsite upon contractor arrival. Initial clean up efforts included containment of the released product with imported fill material, as well as marking and securing the area for further cleanup and remediation activities, currently still in progress.

  • Description: Package was enroute to be delivered our customer located in Gilbert AZ. Upon arrival, the package was refused as it was seen there was staining on the bottom of the package indicating a possible spill inside. Inspection of the package found a fiberboard box containing 4 smaller boxes with 2plastic container in each. Each container held 2L of product. There was no moisture barriers nor dunnage reported with this spill. Inspection of the package found a hairline crack on the bottom of one of the packages allowing for a leak. it is not known how the crack occured. Pckage was contained in a steel salvage drum and Shipper was contacted for disposition

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal UPH experienced a UN1789 "Crown Muriatic Acid" release from boxes containing 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-gallons of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. A total of (12) 1-gallon poly jugs were damaged and leaking. Crew containerized all but 2 cases of product into (6) poly drums. A total of 30 cases were damaged due to impact. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: 1. X-2023020994 It appears when the drums were loaded they were squeezed and this forced liquid out of a vent and onto the top of each of the 12 drums. 2. X-2023020995 12 plastic drums of UN2357 have liquid on top of the drums. It appears when the drums were loaded they were squeezed and this forced ~liquid (4oz each drum) out of a vent and onto the top of each of the 12 drums. The 12 drums with 8(3) fluid on top of them are in the ~nose of the trlr. The trlr ha s a foul odor of acid inside of it. None of the liquid has spilled over the top rim of the drums. So there is no ~spill on the trlr floor or over the side of the drums. 130 has moved the trlr away from the dock and is monitoring the trlr while it is on the ~yard to check for any drips or leaks co ming out of the trlr. 130 has been instructed to callback on the Safety Hotline if the trlr has any ~amount of liquid leaking from the trlr. 130 does not want to enter the trlr because of the acid smell and the presence of (3) flammable ~fumes possibly coming from the liquid on top of the drums.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-07
  • City: Clifton
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CTI INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Video review shows Mr. Lowell travelling at the posted speed limit. Entering a slight curve in the road, Mr. Lowell continues to drive straight crossing over fog line and dropping off of asphalt shoulder onto dirt shoulder. At this time, he tries to correct to the left which caused trailer to tip over and pulls truck and trailer onto their side striking the guard rail. Most of load was lost at accident scene Clifton Fire Department cleaned up the ANPAN on the roadway Emergency Environmental Services(EES) responded to the scene for final cleanup. They had to leave the product in place, which was approved by ADOT, they required a Traffic Plan from ADOT to complete the cleanup. Phase 1 of clean up was on Friday, January 13, 2023 Phase 2 of clean up on Wednesday, January 21, 2023 Samples were taken to ensure proper cleanup. Root Cause, Human Error: The driver stated he was distracted by the scenery, he was not pay attention to the road

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was riding the belt to the appropriate door to be loaded when it toppled off the belt onto the dock landing on it's top causing one of the bottle tops to come off and some of the liquid to leak out. When the package was discovered it was placed upright in a hazmat bag lined tote and taken to QA for processing. DescribePack: The top of one of the bottles came off causing the leak. Even though all the bottles were in plastic bags they weren't sealed tight enough to contain the liquid after the fall. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To mitigate the release of any more liquid the bottle was turned upright and all the other bottle tops were tightened down.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON INSPECTION I NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE ON THE SIDE TO WHERE THE BOTTLES WERE HORIZONTAL. SUSPECTED IMPROPER HANDLING OF THE PACKAGE IS THE REASON. THERE WAS NO INNER SHIPPING BAG FOR THE LIQUID SHIPMENT. THERE ALSO WERE NO INNER CAP SEALS TO HELP PREVENT THE LIQUID LEAKING, PACKAGE WAS IMMEDIATELY STOOD UP STRAIGHT/UPRIGHT SO THE LIQUID WOULD STOP LEAKING. DescribePack: 2 INCH CRACK ON THE SIDE OF THE BOTTLE ACROSS FROM THE HANDLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS GIVEN FULL ATTENTION ASAP AND STOOD UPRIGHT. PLACED IN A SEPARATE BAG.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded in trailer and perhaps toppled over during the unload process and another package landed on top of it causing the weight to compress the cap of one of the inner cans, venting the cap some causing the leak. It wasn't noticed until the package came into view on the trailer floor and the odor was detected very strongly at that time. Wearing proper PPE the package was immediately removed from the trailer and placed in a haz bag lined tote and taken to the QA area for processing. DescribePack: Compression of one of the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was turned upright and the caps were checked and tightened down.

item.title: Report E-2023010126
item.description:
Report E-2023010126

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-06
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 55-Gallon metal drum was discovered cracked and slowly leaking while staged on the dock at the terminal. The bottom of the drum is cracked which appears to be faulty packaging as well as the shipper's faulty skid being broken, contributing to the cracking. About (1/2)gal released onto the dock which quickly evaporated. When terminal was asked if they would be able to place an over-pack over top and flip it over to prevent further leaking, the terminal discovered the drum was completely empty and had likely released all (55)gal in transit which must have evaporated. Area was cleaned and drum was placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023010386
item.description:
Report E-2023010386

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-31
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Circle K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 31, 2022, at 1216 ET, Circle K reported UN1203 "Gasoline" released 7,285-gallons due to a multiple-vehicle accident from a 9,000-gallon tanker. ERTS dispatched Emergency Environmental Services (EES) to perform all onsite clean up operations. On December 31, 2022, at 1250 ET, ESS estimated 7,285-gallons of product released impacting the concrete curbing 4,000-feet (ft.) by 2-ft. leading directly into four storm drains, a 1000-ft. by 2-ft. area of curbing that was impacted by PFAS, and a 60-ft. by 150-ft. area of asphalt from the initial crash. ESS pressure-washed the asphalt roadway, curbing, storm drain catch basin and piping systems and collected an estimate 60,000-gallons of impacted water into frac tanks. ESS collected and containerized (11) 55-gallon metal drums of soil and absorbents that were deployed by the fire department. All waste staged onsite. Additional remediation pending.

item.title: Report I-2023010084

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-09
  • City: Phoenix
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the PM sort operations at the Fedex Express sort facility in Phoenix, Az, a fiberboard box was observed leaking. Further investigation indicated the box contained a bottle of wine and a metal can of butane lighter fluid which is fully regulated as UN1950 Aerosols Flammable. The inner contents of the liquor bottle spilled out. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the packaging, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. The following package is being held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report I-2022120315
item.description:
Report I-2022120315

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-20
  • City: Phoenix
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The customer's checked bag had flown from Los Cabos to Phoenix an American Airlines Flight 2841/20Nov had cleared CBP and TSA in Phoenix and was brought to the baggage transfer point to connect to American Airlines Flight 623 to Kansas City. The bag caught fire at the baggage transfer point. The bag was pulled to the ground and the fire went out on its own. The cause of the fire was a torch lighter in the customer's bag. The weight of the bag must have pOshed on the activation valve of the lighter and it self ignited inside the customefs bag. Airport Crash, Fire, Rescue and Airport Police responded and spoke to the customer along with American Airlines who informed the customer that torch Iighters are never permitted on American Airlines aircraft. The bag was sent to the American Airlines Baggage Service Office where it and the lighter are being held for FAA investigation.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO requested a transfer of UN1307 from a metal 350-gallon tote. The spout was hit by a forklift and dripped product to the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due a forklift hitting the spout, causing damage. The material was transferred into seven 55-gallon closed top metal drums. One 55-gallon metal drum of impacted absorbents and plastic waste was generated. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: There is damage to one of the kits. The bottoms of the two cans are dented and partially inverted. However, there no damage to outer container besides stain from internal leakage. Assuming the cause of the leak was from the failed seal at the bottom of the can, epoxy from can labelled "B" leaked on to other container and outer packaging. Package was brought to damaged hazmat area for further investigation. DescribePack: Bottom seal on can labelled "B" allowed for internal leakage to outer packaging. One kit had a fair amount of damage to cans; whereas the other kit was in excellent condition. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in appropriate area with ventilation and waiting to be packed in lined salvage drum.

  • City: PHOENIX

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal UPH contacted ERTS to request assistance cleaning a spill of regulated UN1133 Adhesives. XPO stated that there is a strong odor coming from the trailer preventing them from accessing the material. ERTS dispatched Patriot Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 1440 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 gallons of product released from two 1-gallon metal pails. A total of 24 pails were collected due to contamination and placed into a 55 gallon metal drum. Absorbents were worked into a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor that was impacted. All impacted absorbents were then collected and containerized into a 30 gallon metal drum. All waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0455 ET, XPO reported a pallet of UN3266 ZEP MORADO SUPER CLEANER had been tipped over in a trailer. At least 5 gallons of product had been spilled. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct cleanup. At 0700 ET, Patriot arrived on-site at and observed a toppled pallet of 5-gallon pails containing Zep Morado Super Cleaner with at least one pail leaking from the lid. Patriot secured the leaking pail and re-stacked the remaining pails. Crew confirmed 2 gallons released to a 4' x 6' area of the trailer floor. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and then collected along with the damaged pail into a 55 gallon poly drum. Three additional pails were found damaged but not releasing, these were placed into a separate 55 gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 13, 2022, two (2) 5-gallon pails containing Chloroenzotrifuorides (UN2234) were damaged due to a nail puncture and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. RLC retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GME) to perform the necessary corrective actions. GME personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all UN2234-impacted material, as well as the two damaged drums, into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal in RLCs facility waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2022100446
item.description:
Report E-2022100446

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-12
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 12, 2022, at 1245 ET, XPO Logistics terminal UPH called to report an unknown amount of corrosive liquid "Sikadur 52" that released onto trailer #3152274 at dock door 120 due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct cleanup. At 1450 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20 ounces of product released from (5) 1 gallon metal pails due to the pails being crushed & punctured by a pallet. Absorbents were worked into a 1' x 1' area of the impacted trailer floor. The damaged pails and cleanup debris were them collected and containerized into a 30 gallon poly drum. The remaining pails were wiped clean and re-stacked for shipment on. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DescribePack: The point of failure was no bottle itself, it was the protective seal underneath the cap. Wasn't completely sealed around the edges. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Gloves were worn to protect my skin. Absorbent pads were placed inside the bag to soak up the excess 1C liquid.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 17, 2022, ERTS received a request to dispatch a remediation contractor to address a reported spill from a single 330-gallon plastic tote of UN2924. Following contractor arrival and assessment of the involved cargo, it was determined that a single tote leaked A2 (UN2924) from a pinhole size puncture believed to have been caused by the plastic tote rubbing against a tote label holder. Media affected was appropriately addressed using granular absorbent, prior to contractor departure and waste generated was transported and properly disposed of on Oct. 10, 2022.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0841 ET, XPO logistics terminal UTU called to request assistance with an unknown amount of UN3266 released inside of trailer #3216748. The release was due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched Southwest Hazard Control to conduct cleanup. At 1115 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 gallon of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to load shift crushing the pails. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 5 gallon poly pail. Crew located 4 damaged pails of product which were placed into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 10:558 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UPH. It was reported that an unknown amount of Zep Morado Super Clean were released from 5-gallon plastic pails due to the pallet falling over while loading. The release impacted the inside of trailer #4630677. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct cleanup. At 1335 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 gallons of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor. The damaged jug and cleanup debris were placed into a 30 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022081056
item.description:
Report E-2022081056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-22
  • City: Laveen
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 07:40 on 8/22/2022 a trailer parked at 6212 South 75th Avenue #4 in Laveen was observed to have a colorless cloud emanating from the back. The trailer was loaded with waste containers enroute to disposal facilities. The observer, who works at a nearby facility, moved the trailer to an adjacent open property and called 911. The fire department responded and found that the waste in one container at the back of the trailer had reacted and the reaction impacted three other poly drums. Kary Environmental, took over the response after the fire department released the scene. Kary Environmental cleaned up the wastes released from the container and overpacked the three adjacent containers that were damaged. All affected wastes remained in the trailer, there was no release to the ground during the incident and there was no damage to the trailer. Their report indicates the possible cause as being incompatible materials being packed in the same drum. Due to the nature of this incident it is impossible to provide better estimates of the release. Three of the four drums were consolidated wastes from different retail pick ups. Arizona Department of Environmental Quality conducted an on-site inspection on August 23, 2022, no deficiencies were noted in the course of their inspection.

item.title: Report E-2022080304
item.description:
Report E-2022080304

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-29
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 10:45 on July 29, 2022 a PCB Release was discovered on an incoming trailer that was staged at dock 2 for offloading. The exact amount of oil released is not able to be determined, but is estimated to be between 1 quart and 1 gallon of oil. The estimate is based on the level of oil remaining in the transformer. The release was from splashing out of the top of the transformer during transportation. The transformer did not have a gasket seal in place and the top was loose with the restraining bolt only lightly tightened, this allowed oil to splash up and over the transformer. PCB oil concentration is 104 PPM. Contacted surfaces and media are: metal ramp and fiberglass wall of the trailer, a pallet jack in the trailer, wood floor planking in the trailer, and water that had accumulated in the loading dock well from a recent rain. Water collected from dock well for disposal as PCB contaminated water, wood form the immediate spill will be removed from floor of trailer for disposal as PCB debris, metal pallet jack decontaminated with kerosene, wheels of pallet jack replaced, metal flooring and inside wall of trailer decontaminated with kerosene.

item.title: Report E-2022070280
item.description:
Report E-2022070280

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-23
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 7:55 AM MST on 6/23/2022 a Veolia employee was moving a large drained 50 - 499 PCB transformer in the yard to be loaded for transportation to US Ecology. One of the forks of the lift contacted the bottom valve of the transformer below the fins and broke the valve releasing residual PCB liquids that had collected in the bottom of the transformer after draining. Approximately 1 quart of the PCB oil was released on the asphalt surface. The RQ for PCBs (1 pound) was not met. The PCB content of the transformer was listed as 210 ppm of 1260 PCB. We collected approximately 4 gallons of residual oil from the broken valve. The transformer was received as PCB Drained 50 -499 ppm. Speedy-dry applied to the spill area to absorb any free liquid, followed by double wash with kerosene and a final wash with de-greasing detergent. Initially three 100 cm2 wipe samples were collected from the spill area. The spill was contained, the area cleaned, and samples collected by 13:04 MST. Spill duration was approximately 5 hours. An additional 3 samples of asphalt from the spill area were also collected the following day at the request of the EPA.

  • Description: On June 14th, 2022, two (2) 5-gallon pails of Zep Morado Super Cleaner fell during transit and released approximately four (4) gallons to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Emergency Environmental Services, LLC (EES) to perform the necessary corrective action. EES personnel drummed the damaged containers, then utilized soda ash, degreaser, and absorbents to remediate the impacted surface.

item.title: Report I-2022090167
item.description:
Report I-2022090167

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-02
  • City: Benson
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CTI INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Description: Operator was in the process of loading the last load from railcar MDCX1175 into trailer 8120. Driver had given him the signal that the trailer was half full. In preparation, operator shut down the compressor air and returned to railcar. He then was going to switch the airline but failed to ensure the air valve was closed. When he removed the airline, product travelled from the product hose connection back into the airline which started to spray acid which sprayed onto the operator. Operator was sent to hospital in Tucson for treatment. Invetigative Findings: Operator failed to close the air valve on the product hose before removing the hose. Operator did not have the required PPE as stated in the SOP(No Acid Suit Jacket, No Respirator, No Acid Hood, Using dark face shield at night and in up position). Operator did not rinse for 15 minutes after being sprayed as outlined in the SOP based on an estimated timeline. Operator left the loading process unattended to scale out previous truck which is violation of the SOP. Driver was refusing treatment, Safety Coordinator instructed operator to seek medical attention and was transported by the driver. Root Cause: Operator failed to follow several steps in the SOP. Main cause is valve was not properly secured.

item.title: Report I-2022090270
item.description:
Report I-2022090270

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-23T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-15
  • City: Phoenix
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FIBERBOARD BOX WAS OBSERVED LEAKING DURING THE PM OPERATIONS AT THE FEDEX EXPRESS RAMP IN PHOENIX, AZ. FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE PACKAGE CONTAINED SIX PLASTIC BOTTLES OF PRC STANDARD PR 148 CLEAR PINT. PER THE ASSOCIATED SDS FOR THIS PRODUCT IT INDICATES THE PRODUCT IS FULLY REGULATED AS UN 1993 FLAMMABLE LIQUID, N.O.S TECHNICAL NAME TOLUENE, ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL PG III. ONE OF THE BOTTLES BROKE AND LEAKED INTO THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKINGS OR LABELS ON THE PACKAGING, AND NO SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS WAS OFFERED WITH THE SHIPMENT. FOLLOWING SPILL CLEANUP, THE INVOLVED PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE OF A SALVAGE DRUM AND HELP PENDING FURTHER DISPOSITION INSTRUCTIONS.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1049 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UPH. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of UN1263 H/G White Epoxy Color #17925 released from (2) 1 gallon metal pails due to improper loading. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The damaged pails and all cleanup debris were placed into a 5 gallon metal drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to QA from one of the van lines here it was noticed to be wet on the bottom. The package had been placed in a lined bin. DescribePack: The jug was inside a plastic bag. It was clear that the jug had leaked (it was wetter inside the bag and the box than the outside, and the color of the leaked fluid matched the contents), but we couldn't determine the source of the leak. The spilled amount was small. There were no notable sings of damage to the box or contents except that they were wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red HAZMAT bin.
